definition: to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: Significantly, this leakage includes a large share of high-performing officers.
sentences.chinese: 值得關注的是，這種外流很大一部分是能力強的軍官。

sentences.english: And a developing country may become stalled at the brain drain stage.
sentences.chinese: 在人才外流階段發展中國家的發展可能會陷入停滯。

sentences.english: Capital outflows from China are also presenting issues for regulators.
sentences.chinese: 中國監管部門還面臨着資金外流的問題。

sentences.english: It shows a fox being disembowelled by a pack of hounds.
sentences.chinese: 畫面中一隻狐狸正被一羣獵狗撕咬得腸子外流。

sentences.english: Do labor force migration and food security in major food sales regions have consensus or conflict?
sentences.chinese: 主銷區農村勞動力外流與糧食安全一致抑或分歧？

sentences.english: They find it difficult to keep good staff because of the brain drain.
sentences.chinese: 由於人才外流，他們很難保住一班齊備的人馬了。

sentences.english: The outflow of aqueous humor can be decreased by several mechanisms.
sentences.chinese: 引起房水外流減少的原因有下列幾種。

sentences.english: My left ear aches a lot; and also ichor flows out of there.
sentences.chinese: 我左耳很疼，而且還有膿水往外流。

sentences.english: When the pipe was unblocked, the water drained out.
sentences.chinese: 水管未關，水隨便往外流。

sentences.english: Some of experts in Russia were drained away to the United states in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 最近幾年俄羅斯一些專家外流到了美國。

sentences.english: This country is being drained of its best talents.
sentences.chinese: 這個國家最優秀的人才在不斷外流。

sentences.english: When the money will be allowed to go out or the growth slowdowns then the … bubble will explode.
sentences.chinese: 當錢允許外流或增長減速慢時，那麼泡沫就爆炸了。

sentences.english: Why is migration a problem for global health?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼人才外流會影響全球衛生？

sentences.english: Hearing the news, Chong Er escaped from the state of Jin, remaining a fugitive for more than ten years.
sentences.chinese: 重耳聞訊，逃出了晉國，在外流忘十幾年。

sentences.english: The “brain drain” may also undermine medical training in future.
sentences.chinese: “人才外流”還可能破壞未來的醫療培訓。

definition: to flow back/reflux/circumfluence/refluence/backward flow/returning flow (e.g. of talent)
(of soil etc) to wash away/to be eroded/(fig.) (of talented staff, followers of a religious faith, investment funds etc) to go elsewhere/to fail to be retained
hot money, money flowing from one currency to another in the hope of quick profit
to flow/to circulate/to go from place to place/to be mobile/(of assets) liquid
a steady flow (idiom); an unending stream
to transfuse blood/to give aid and support
to intensify/to sharpen/to accelerate/to aggravate/to exacerbate/to embitter
